text: Edabaghine Mosque () or mosque of the tanners is a Tunisian mosque in the Medina of Tunis. It does not exist anymore.Mohamed Belkhodja, Tārīkh maʻālim al-tawḥīd fī al-qadīm wa-fī al-Jadīd, Tunis, al-Maṭbaʻah al-Tūnisīyah, 1939, 429 p == Localization== The mosque was located in souk Edabaghine. It has now been replaced by new houses. == Etymology== It was named after the tanners, called Edabaghine in Arabic, who surrounded the mosque. ==References== Category:Mosques in Tunis
title: Edabaghine Mosque
